FuncDef:
The active port-macsec command activates the MACsec license of interfaces on a board.
The undo active port-macsec command deactivates the MACsec license of interfaces on a board.
By default, the MACsec license of interfaces on a board is not activated.
CLIs: undo active port-macsec slot <slotid> card <cardid> [ port <port-list> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interface list of a board, with the interfaces separated by commas (,) or hyphens (-).
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the slot ID of a board.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To activate the MACsec license of interfaces on a board, run the active port-macsec command. You can run the undo active port-macsec command to deactivate the MACsec license of interfaces on a subcard or board.
Prerequisites
The license file has been loaded for MACsec.
The license file on the master main control board has been activated by running the license active file-name command.

Precautions
An interface supports MACsec only after the MACsec license is activated using this command.
